1.name: HIOKI EUROPE GmbH
1.description: HIOKI is a Japanese manufacturer of test and measurement equipment founded in 1935. We focus on products like power analyzers, current sensors, impedance / battery testers and data acquisition systems, helping our customers developing solutions to today‘s energy and mobility challenges. Today 1000 colleagues at HIOKI generate a global turnover of around 200 million EUR. In 2017 HIOKI EUROPE was founded as sales subsidiary near Frankfurt, Germany and together with a network of specialized sales partners we have embarked on a long-term journey to increase our market presence in Europe and to make the brand HIOKI as well-known as in our Japanese home market. We are looking for you as aProduct Manager Battery Testers (f/m/d) based in Eschborn, near Frankfurt/Main Your responsibilities·      Develop sales tools like training materials, product presentations, sales guides and application notes·      Perform market and competitor analysis·      Writing technical content for social and printed media to support the marketing department ·      Support Hioki sales managers, partners and end users on technical support questions·      Perform other job-related duties as required Your skills and qualifications·      Minimum 2 year of experience as a Product Manager·      Minimum 2 year of working experience in the battery manufacturing industry ·      Communication skills, team attitude and organizational skills·      Technical content writing·      Good English skills on business level for external communication spoken and written·      Knowledge of electrical engineering·      Knowledge of or experience in Test & Measurement ·      Analytical Skills and attention to detail·      Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines·      Good team player with the drive to grow with the company long-term What we are offering·      A young, fast-growing company that is backed by a strong enterprise·      An intercultural working environment with flat hierarchies·      Exciting, responsible tasks in a highly motivated team and a long-term perspective Tipps: Vermitteln Sie einen Überblick über die Position, beschreiben Sie, was es heißt, in dieser Position erfolgreich zu sein und welchen Stellenwert die Position für das Unternehmen hat.

2.name: BSI
2.description:
To all IT product managers with entrepreneurial genes: Transform the customer journey of millions of customers at a software manufacturer where the “Future of Work” is present. Do you want to work as a manager in a team of top talent? By being challenged and encouraged and by everyone pulling together? Are you thinking entrepreneurially?Then read on!About the companyImagine you have a support request with your insurance company and the person you're talking to already knows who you are and maybe even knows why you're calling. Wouldn't you feel better understood and save everyone a lot of time and make work easier? BSI Software's solutions are responsible for 220 million success stories of this kind: understanding customers and creating experiences. That's progress! In order to create great products, great employees are at work to provide their own ideas. This is the DNA of BSI Software. Your expertise and input are not only in demand, but required. Large banks, insurance companies and omni-channel sales companies work with BSI's products to make the customer journey an experience. “Our customers are thrilled about our software because it makes customers happy and, in addition to meaning, is fun.” Thomas Hellmann Project Manager BSI Software Understanding the customer is crucial for the integration of the CRM/CX products of the BSI Suite. The project manager is in the crucial position to ensure this. In this position you are given the opportunity to design your workplace yourself, the way you want to work. You yourself make the difference. In return, you get the freedom and support to explore new paths. Enjoy the security of an established software company that is aware of the dynamics of customer requirements and actively shape growth. “With every step, the result counts for the customer, which is why at BSI we always say: just do it! Because of our proximity to the customer, everyone can use their freedom to make customers successful without bureaucracy.” Sally, BSI SoftwareAt BSI Software, as a project manager, you are responsible for the content management of the implementation of standard software. Coordinate the team; As a single point of contact with the customer, the entire range of tasks from initial negotiations to delivery is your responsibility. You are responsible for setting up and developing the teams for product launches in an organization with maximum degrees of freedom - with customer focus in mind There is a focus and no hierarchies. You lead all activities from pre-sales to implementation in long-term and strategic projects at large companies to success. The industry focus is on banks, insurance companies and omni-channel retailers and many other companies for which customer experience is essential. Work in a solution-oriented environment in which agility is embodied and not viewed dogmatically. Experience a high-performing company: your leadership skills Ability to bring the team and the individual to peak performance. This position is for someone who wants to support leading companies in a long-term and collaborative manner. Use your skills to help customers achieve greater success and satisfied users and make the everyday work of thousands of people easier. Your advantages: Unlimited development opportunities within the company Company investments Further training budget for free use 10% of working time is for innovation No hierarchies, but a network for great development opportunities
What you should bring: Experience in the development/management of digital productsProject management expertiseLeadership experienceExperience in customer managementYou have a talent for building and developing teamsBusiness case experience in one of the industries: banks, insurance, retail
This is what you are offered: Unlimited development opportunities in the companyA team that stands behind the products and rocks!A team that supports and encourages each otherNo elbow mentalityAgile working at the core - without fake ceremonies
Interested in finding out more? Then apply now and we will get back to you as soon as possible. In the next step you will find out your options and further details about the position. We look forward to receiving your application! IOX Partners has been commissioned by BSI Software to fill these and other positions. Your contact person at IOX Partners: Rafael Crefeld

EXPERIENCE: Experience in the development management of digital products

8.name: NeuroNation - Mind & Brain Health Technology
8.description:
NeuroNation is a leading Brain Training platform that empowers more than 20 million people all over the world in staying fit and independent in their lives.We collaborate closely with scientists and universities to achieve the best results possible. Our engaging apps have received awards from major health insurance companies, such as the AOK, funded by the German Federal Ministry of Health. Also, NeuroNation has been awarded by Apple and Google. Our medical app can be prescribed by doctors in Germany, while cost are covered by the public health insurance.In this role, you will be a key driver of the ensuring that our technical and regulatory workflows are operating effectively as well as compliant to regulations, and that our technical projects are implemented properly. This especially includes requirements on data privacy, data security, and medical regulations are fulfilled in our organisation and technical projects.This way, you contribute to having a positive impact on the lives of millions of people all over the world. So, if you want to help us shape a better tomorrow, join us today!What will you do? Define and document technical software requirements as well as processes to fulfill compliance standards, e.g. data security and privacy requirements under GDPR, ISO 27001, ISO 13485, IEC 62304, MDR, and future regulations on Digital Health Applications (DiGA)Lead technical projects involving new features for our product and business processes to ensure the success of our organisationWrite and maintain processes (SOPs), policies, and other documentation under our Information Security Management System (ISMS) / Quality Management System (QMS)Work closely with developers to translate software requirements into actionable technical requirements during implementation, and guide them during the full development processConduct regular audits to assess and improve compliance under our ISMS / QMS and the relevant regulationsMonitor and improve compliance of the organisation and staff under our ISMS / QMS Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices related to compliance, data security, data privacy, and medical device regulations.
What experience should you bring?Must-Haves: Fluency in both German and EnglishProven experience in related roles, having successfully led and completed compliance / regulatory projects in software companies that required to work directly with developers Strong technical background with the ability to understand complex software systemsIn-depth, practical knowledge of ISO 27001 and GDPR (other regulations can be learnt in this role)Strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and operate at high speedStrong communication and interpersonal skills
Nice2Have / learnable: Bonus: In-depth knowledge of ISO 13485, IEC 62304, MDR and other regulations around medical devicesBonus: Experience with SQL
Who are we looking for? You are PASSIONATE about having a positive impact on people’s livesYou have a personal interest in SELF-IMPROVEMENTYou have at least 3 years of experience in related rolesYou are located in a timezone +-2h from Berlin (CET)You are a team-player and love to help out your colleagues

12.name: Tourismus Initiative München (TIM) e.V.
12.description:
The Tourismus Initiative München (TIM) e.V. is the association of the Munich tourism industry, consisting of around 200 tourism service providers, and is the only cross-industry network that represents all of the major companies in Munich tourism, such as the BMW World, Munich Airport and the Olympic Park Catering and hotel businesses, retail representatives and companies from the congress and cultural industries. We are a mouthpiece and community for knowledge transfer, innovation and cooperation, support the city of Munich as a strong, independent partner through our specialist expertise and participation in the tourism fund and support the service providers in TIM in designing travel services. Since 2012, the collaboration with our partner Munich Tourism, the tourism institution of the state capital of Munich, in the so-called Munich Model has stood for innovation in tourism marketing and for the city's future as a prosperous tourism metropolis. TIM e.V. is expanding its scope of responsibility and taking over product management for tourism services Munich. The aim is to make the Munich tourist brand a sustainable experience through product management and to lead to top performance. To implement this, TIM e.V. is looking for a dedicated part-time product manager (m/f/d) (20 hours per week) for the Munich office. Your tasks : Advising the service providers on the optimization and new introduction of tourism products using the brand rules and strategic goals. Creating “operating instructions” for the service providers in order to help them optimize the product as best as possible. Developing implementation proposals ready for decision-making for the brand steering group. Active interface management for stakeholder management and for Marketing department at Munich TourismAnalysis of all relevant contact points of the brand (continuous)Planning and controlling of projects as a source of inspiration as well as responsibility for achieving defined goals
You are a particularly good fit for us if you have initial experience in the following areas: Brand management, tourism product management, project management and budgeting, stakeholder management, market and trend research, innovation management
Your personal profile: Tourism training or study Networker, communicative, integrative and empathic Flexible, resilient and independent Interest in political and social contexts Enthusiasm for tourism and leisure Entrepreneurial thinking High willingness to learn
Our offer: responsible and varied tasks in a renowned association, structured training in a team, flexible working hours and hybrid home office options, flat hierarchies, open communication and direct decision-making paths, personal and professional development opportunities, a modern office in Munich's old town

Your Mission We are currently building the core team and you can be one of the first employees. Our goal is to become the number one for intelligent charging hardware. You quickly and confidently test and validate our ideas with customers, evaluate the results and drive the implementation of promising features so that customers and users can get the most out of our solutions.

Very good English skills are a prerequisite for this position, German is a big plus. 
What you can expect from us Agile teams & active participation: We work in an agile way and develop solutions for our target groups in a cross-team way. Using KPIs, our teams set their own targets, aligned with our strategic company targets. Extensive onboarding: As part of our cross-team onboarding, you will gain insights into each of our teams as well as our company culture and values. In addition, all newbies get an onboarding buddy whom they can ask for advice on all matters. Growth mindset: We support your individual learning needs, since we believe that learning as well as personal and professional development is key for success. Team work makes the dream work: ... that's why we meet monthly for joint team events, as well as once a year for a team retreat. Work-Life-Integration: We have 28 days of holiday per year as well as further days off between Christmas and New Year. In addition, we offer you a hybrid work set up to have the best possible work-life-balance. Sustainable transportation and corporate fitness: We subsidise public transport tickets or a JobRad membership. Alternatively, you can choose to go for an EGYM Wellpass membership. Because mental health matters: You’ll have access to the platform nilo.health and the opportunity to participate in six free and individual sessions per year with a psychologist or business coach. 
About usLOCIO was founded in August 2022 by Alexander and Eduard to make the billing of electric company cars as simple as possible. We have been developing our products in our office in Munich since 2021 and successfully started the first series production at the beginning of 2023. Our goal is to become the largest provider for the digital management of electric company fleets in the next few years. With our first product LinkOne, we have redefined the billing of electric company cars from scratch.We believe that diversity of all kinds enriches our teams and a diverse work environment fosters innovation. 32.name: JetBrains
32.description:
JetBrains creates tools that make professional software development a more productive and enjoyable experience. Kotlin is a modern but mature programming language aimed at making developers happier. It's concise, safe, interoperable with Java and other languages, and provides many ways to reuse code between multiple platforms for productive programming.In recent years, the number of users has grown steadily, and the language has cornered several large niches in the market. Today, Kotlin is used worldwide by over 5 million developers and is used to develop products in companies like Google, Uber, Atlassian, and Microsoft.We’re looking for an experienced product manager to join the Kotlin team and take responsibility for the success of one of our products: The Kotlin/JVM compiler backend, responsible for JVM bytecode generation, is currently the most popular Kotlin backend. It’s used for Android, server-side, and library/framework development, and it’s also part of our Kotlin Multiplatform technology, which we are actively developing.The Kotlin build tools and utilities are designed to help developers create, build, test and manage Kotlin projects. For any programming language, easy build configuration and fast compilation are important conditions for adoption. Various build systems such as Gradle, JPS, and Maven are currently supported, and this list may expand in the future.
Developing a programming language as a product is a challenge that has no ready-made solutions. In addition to the unique experience of the role, a successful candidate will make life easier for millions of developers all over the world and be able to influence the way software products are created. The Kotlin Roadmap will help you understand the team’s current objectives and priorities.In this role, you will: Extensively interact with users to identify their needs, problems, and ways to solve them.Conduct UX and market research needed to gain insights and make informed decisions.Identify product metrics needed for monitoring success and data-driven decisions.Generate, prioritize, and test hypotheses, sometimes using out-of-the-box methods.Define and implement a product vision and strategy that aligns with our overall goals and objectives.Develop and maintain a product roadmap that addresses short- and long-term product goals.Build from scratch and incrementally improve the product development process.Work closely with developers, analysts, technical writers, developer advocates, and marketing and product managers across Kotlin and JetBrains.Cooperate with the authors of third-party libraries, frameworks, and tools.
We will be happy to have you on our team if you: Have at least 3 years of product management, or equivalent experience.Have a deep understanding of product metrics and strong research skills.Have a technical education or software development experience.Are familiar with programming languages and modern software development practices.Are comfortable working in a highly technical domain.Are ready to learn Kotlin and become an active user.Have strong leadership skills and the ability to motivate and manage cross-functional teams.Are proficient in English with strong spoken and written communication skills.
We process the data provided in your job application in accordance with the Recruitment Privacy Policy (https://www.jetbrains.com/legal/privacy/privacy-recruitment.html)

48.description:
About us CleanHub uses the power of software to reduce ocean-bound plastic by 50% before 2030. We build digital tools to track and scale plastic collection in coastal regions around the world. CleanHub partners with sustainable consumer brands to finance the collection of ocean-bound plastic with every product they sell. Read more about us on ourwebsite.  Your mission CleanHub uses technology to address one of the world’s most pressing issues: ocean plastic.2bn people do not have access to effective waste management. Our lightweight platform enables effective waste management to be set up quickly in the coastal areas where it’s needed most.Through our app we track and trace the entire logistics chain to provide the digital evidence for every kg of plastic that did not end up in our oceans. Check out ourlive impact. CleanHub partners with sustainable consumer brands to finance the collection of ocean bound plastic with every product they sell.We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager to lead the growth of our Impact Platform for Brand Marketeers. This is how our brands manage and communicate their environmental impact. See what we’ve done so farhere.You will be joining CleanHub at a critical and exciting time. So far we financed the collection of 5,500,000kg (equivalent to 550 million soda bottles) of ocean bound plastic - now it’s time to scale the impact.In this role, you will report to our VP Product and work as part of a cross-functional team.  What you are going to do:  Own the outcome- own the roadmap and strategy for your product. Continuously prioritise the opportunities that are most likely to measurably impact your roadmap outcomeUnderstand user needs- help the whole team to understand what problems we need to solve and whyBe all over the data- make intelligent decisions backed up by quantitative and qualitative insightsFail successfully - design experiments that allow us to learn quickly so that we focus our resources on what worksInfluence and lead - work shoulder to shoulder with your team and inspire them to build an amazing product for our customers. Communicate the vision and maximise the value you get from making everyone at CleanHub feel part of the product team.
  Your profile You tick these boxes:  A minimum of 3 years experience in product management, ideally in a startup environment working in cross-functional teams to an outcome-based roadmap.You have launched new products or features to active users and used data and feedback to make them better.It’s a big plus if you have experience with social media, consumer activism, community-driven products or Edtech (but not essential)
  These are the things you’re known for:  Curiosity— you can’t wait to learn about and understand new thingsAll about the problem— you’re obsessive about the problem you’re solving and the people you’re solving it for. You’re an intuitive researcher.Prioritisation— you’re a master of saying “no” and focussing on the right thingsPredisposed to action— when you see an issue, you don’t sit on your hands, you challenge, you get things doneOutcomes focussed— you care about solving problems (outcomes) not on looking busy (outputs)Communication— you can get ideas out there clearly, with the engineer, the designer or the CEORelationships— you can build strong, trusting relationships, even with people who don’t work in the same way as you.Technology— you understand what can be done now on web and mobile and other platforms and you’re excited about what’s coming nextDesign— you recognise good design when you see it — you have a sixth sense for what a good user experience looks and feels like.Detail and quality— you ‘sweat the detail’ and do the hard work needed to make something you’ve produced feel easy and elegantData with empathy— you’re excited about discovering insights in a spreadsheet but you’re quick to relate your findings back to real peoplePeople — you can put yourself in others’ shoes and understand things from their perspective (both with your users and with your colleagues)
  Why us? Join our impact-driven team to enable the circular economy and stop plastic ending up in our oceans:  A job with purpose, you work together with a team dedicated to solve one of the planet’s biggest challengesA job with high impact, both on the environment as well as on the shape and structure of a fast-growing startup. As one of the first product managers you will be core to building an amazing product culture at CleanHubWe have an office in Berlin (where our founders and part of the team lives) and a growing hub in London. We aim to bring the whole team together in person every quarter. Working remotely is an option for this role.
  We are an equal-opportunity employer and value broad diversity. We consider all applications equally. We will not react to outreach from design or recruiting agencies, freelance is not an option.

53.name: JetBrains
53.description:
JetBrains creates tools that make professional software development a more productive and enjoyable experience. Kotlin is a modern but mature programming language aimed at making developers happier. It's concise, safe, interoperable with Java and other languages, and provides many ways to reuse code between multiple platforms for productive programming.In recent years, the number of users has grown steadily, and the language has cornered several large niches in the market. Today, Kotlin is used worldwide by over 5 million developers and is used to develop products in companies like Google, Uber, Atlassian, and Microsoft.We’re looking for an experienced product manager to join the Kotlin team and take responsibility for the success of one of our products: The Kotlin/JVM compiler backend, responsible for JVM bytecode generation, is currently the most popular Kotlin backend. It’s used for Android, server-side, and library/framework development, and it’s also part of our Kotlin Multiplatform technology, which we are actively developing.The Kotlin build tools and utilities are designed to help developers create, build, test and manage Kotlin projects. For any programming language, easy build configuration and fast compilation are important conditions for adoption. Various build systems such as Gradle, JPS, and Maven are currently supported, and this list may expand in the future.
Developing a programming language as a product is a challenge that has no ready-made solutions. In addition to the unique experience of the role, a successful candidate will make life easier for millions of developers all over the world and be able to influence the way software products are created. The Kotlin Roadmap will help you understand the team’s current objectives and priorities.In this role, you will: Extensively interact with users to identify their needs, problems, and ways to solve them.Conduct UX and market research needed to gain insights and make informed decisions.Identify product metrics needed for monitoring success and data-driven decisions.Generate, prioritize, and test hypotheses, sometimes using out-of-the-box methods.Define and implement a product vision and strategy that aligns with our overall goals and objectives.Develop and maintain a product roadmap that addresses short- and long-term product goals.Build from scratch and incrementally improve the product development process.Work closely with developers, analysts, technical writers, developer advocates, and marketing and product managers across Kotlin and JetBrains.Cooperate with the authors of third-party libraries, frameworks, and tools.
We will be happy to have you on our team if you: Have at least 3 years of product management, or equivalent experience.Have a deep understanding of product metrics and strong research skills.Have a technical education or software development experience.Are familiar with programming languages and modern software development practices.Are comfortable working in a highly technical domain.Are ready to learn Kotlin and become an active user.Have strong leadership skills and the ability to motivate and manage cross-functional teams.Are proficient in English with strong spoken and written communication skills.
We process the data provided in your job application in accordance with the Recruitment Privacy Policy (https://www.jetbrains.com/legal/privacy/privacy-recruitment.html)

In order to continue to grow and take on the challenges of tomorrow, we are looking for you for our Nördlingen location or purely remotely as a (Junior) Product Manager (m/f/d) in the Energy Storage Systems area. We make people more independent. Our customers through our battery technologies. Our employees through more independence. You will develop the product strategy and roadmap with stakeholders from different areas and create market and competition analyses. You support and are responsible for the design of new (digital) business models and services that result from the networking of energy storage, energy management systems and controllable consumers within the decentralized energy world. Together with the product owner, you coordinate the targeted, requirements-based and agile development of the solution components of our product range and ensure high-quality and efficient implementation. You support the documentation and quality assurance of our solutions at the interface between product management, internal customers and external partners. In addition, you will ensure constant optimization of the product offering through active benchmarking of third-party developments with our solution and its components.
What you bring with you: Completed technical or economic studies, e.g. in (commercial) engineering, energy management, electrical engineering, information technology. You have initial professional experience, for example in product management, in the areas of energy storage, renewable energies, energy industry, IoT technologies or e-mobility. In-depth knowledge of renewable energies (photovoltaics, energy storage) as well as the energy and IT industry is an advantage. Ideally, you have already gained knowledge and skills in digital, agile product development. You can prepare and convey complex technical contexts in an understandable and target group-appropriate manner. You are not afraid to take on responsibility in a dynamic environment and to lead topics and tasks to success independently, in a structured, reliable manner and with a high level of self-motivation. You have persuasive and communication skills combined with very good written and spoken German and English skills.

Appfire is an enterprise collaboration software company that enables teams to plan and deliver their best work. Since launching in 2005 as one of the original Atlassian ecosystem partners, Appfire has built a portfolio of top-selling apps for more than 30,000 customers — including 55% of Fortune 500 companies. To all IT product managers with entrepreneurial genes: Transform the customer journey of millions of customers at a software manufacturer where the “Future of Work” is present. Do you want to work as a manager in a team of top talent? By being challenged and encouraged and by everyone pulling together? Are you thinking entrepreneurially?Then read on!About the companyImagine you have a support request with your insurance company and the person you're talking to already knows who you are and maybe even knows why you're calling. Wouldn't you feel better understood and save everyone a lot of time and make work easier? BSI Software's solutions are responsible for 220 million success stories of this kind: understanding customers and creating experiences. That's progress! In order to create great products, great employees are at work to provide their own ideas. This is the DNA of BSI Software. Your expertise and input are not only in demand, but required. Large banks, insurance companies and omni-channel sales companies work with BSI's products to make the customer journey an experience. “Our customers are thrilled about our software because it makes customers happy and, in addition to meaning, is fun.” Thomas Hellmann Project Manager BSI Software Understanding the customer is crucial for the integration of the CRM/CX products of the BSI Suite. The project manager is in the crucial position to ensure this. In this position you are given the opportunity to design your workplace yourself, the way you want to work. You yourself make the difference. In return, you get the freedom and support to explore new paths. Enjoy the security of an established software company that is aware of the dynamics of customer requirements and actively shape growth. “With every step, the result counts for the customer, which is why at BSI we always say: just do it! Because of our proximity to the customer, everyone can use their freedom to make customers successful without bureaucracy.” Sally, BSI SoftwareAt BSI Software, as a project manager, you are responsible for the content management of the implementation of standard software. Coordinate the team; As a single point of contact with the customer, the entire range of tasks from initial negotiations to delivery is your responsibility. You are responsible for setting up and developing the teams for product launches in an organization with maximum degrees of freedom - with customer focus in mind There is a focus and no hierarchies. You lead all activities from pre-sales to implementation in long-term and strategic projects at large companies to success. The industry focus is on banks, insurance companies and omni-channel retailers and many other companies for which customer experience is essential. Work in a solution-oriented environment in which agility is embodied and not viewed dogmatically. Experience a high-performing company: your leadership skills Ability to bring the team and the individual to peak performance. This position is for someone who wants to support leading companies in a long-term and collaborative manner. Use your skills to help customers achieve greater success and satisfied users and make the everyday work of thousands of people easier. Your advantages: Unlimited development opportunities within the company Company investments Further training budget for free use 10% of working time is for innovation No hierarchies, but a network for great development opportunities

129.name: Temedica
129.description:
Let's win together  As an Associate Product Manager, you will contribute to the future of apps at Temedica. You will help patients, our users, to handle their individual health situation better. You will collaborate with experienced Product Managers on defining and driving the products that enable our customers (Pharma Companies) to use data as the voice of the patient, leading to the highest quality user experiences, with the strongest privacy guarantees in the industry. You will work with world-class engineering, data science, and product teams. You will work on the roadmap for our app platform as well as our health apps to improve the live of thousands of people.     Your Role with us   You assist in the planning, development, and implementation of new product features and enhancements.You participate in user research activities, such as user testing and surveys, to gather feedback and improve our products.You conduct market research to gain insight into customer needs, competitive landscape, and industry trends.You analyze product performance metrics, and share insights with the Product Management team.
    What you bring to the table   You gained prior experience in a product-oriented role (i.e. Design, Product Ownership, Product Management, Software Development, Agile Coach / Scrum Master) and you want to continue your professional journey in Product Management.You have strong analytical skills with the ability to convert data into actionable insights.You are familiar with software development concepts and web technologies.You communicate fluently in English and German and have strong presentation and interpersonal skills.
    What we bring to the table  We use data for the better. We create technology that really helps. At Temedica, we break new ground in digital health and challenge the traditional healthcare model. We believe that individualized treatment is a fundamental right of every patient - so we make it happen! We build medical applications and use artificial intelligence to translate patient behavior into sensible interventions. We also combine our application’s data with data sources from research, social listening and key market providers. Based on a B2B SaaS business model, we so offer novel data monitors that secure previously unknown insights for Pharma and Life-sciences to make personalized medicine reality. Finally!You want more? There are a bunch of things that Temedica offers its employees - and we’re talking real benefits, not equipment, fruits and drinks. Of course we take care of your daily caffeine and vitamin supply while you perform your work on state-of-the-art devices, but there’s much more that we do to support our Temedicans, for example:  150€ monthly subsidiary: For whatever makes most sense for you. Starting after the probationary period, you have the freedom to select where to direct your subsidiary from a wide range of options. Whether it's internet at home, a BahnCard or public transport, Kindergarden subsidy, paid time-off, or even your dream workation, the choice is yours to make. And yes, we've also got your back for the long run. Our company pension scheme offers a 50% subsidy, capped at a maximum of 90€ per month, to proactively support your future financial security and help you save for retirement while maximizing your benefits. Mix and match these benefits to create a personalized package that suits your preferences and enhances your work-life balance!Hybrid-work policy: Our hybrid-work policy allows you to work from anywhere within Germany. In your team, you are free to decide when to come to the office and enjoy working and celebrating your wins together. We’re talking 4 days per month here - cool?Company off-sites and kick-offs: These events allow you to knowledge-share and gather a better understanding of how to successfully reach our goals. Let us tell you, the food during these events is also worth a shot! 
We are happy to tell you more about our benefits and way of working at Temedica in a first call!      Apply for this position

This role will deliver value to millions of creative users on a daily basis.If you are passionate about driving customer impact and thrive in a collaborative environment, we would love to hear from you.By joining us, you will benefit from An honest, open culture that emphasises feedback and promotes professional and personal development.Hybrid work model — our team is distributed worldwide, from Armenia to US, UK, Germany, Spain and Romania.Wellbeing benefits (including a monthly wellbeing fund).Growing opportunities — based on your preference you can grow in the company as a people manager or as an individual contributor. An environment that fosters innovation and creativity, a culture with the ability to pilot new trends.
You will Collaborate with executives and business unit leaders to establish a compelling vision, roadmap, and key performance indicators (KPIs) for your product.Lead a cross-functional product team, consisting of Product Design, Engineering, and Data Science professionals, to launch innovative and intuitive Search & Discovery experiences that drive measurable impact on customer behavior.Ensure effective communication by regularly updating the team and stakeholders on Product KPIs and Objectives and Key Results (OKRs).Work closely with our Research team to explore innovative ways to enhance existing products and deliver increased value to users.
About You 3 to 5 years of direct experience tying together asset metadata enrichment, search platform technologies and AI/ML driven ranking algorithms to deliver best-in-class search & discovery productsHas excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively convey ideas and influence stakeholders.Has proven experience in taking rough ideas from concept to planning and successful product launches.Is comfortable working collaboratively in real-time and asynchronously across different time zones.Has experience working in a scaled product environment, leveraging insights and roadmaps from other teams.Is passionate about fostering creativity and driving innovation.
What we seek and value most in our candidatesProfessionalism in both soft and hard skills; motivation to grow, learn and share, positive attitude, flexibility, transparency, ownership and the most important - passion and commitment.Picsart is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.Picsart, Inc. is an E-Verify Employer in the US. Please click here for the E-Verify Poster in English or Spanish. For information regarding your Right To Work, please click here for English or Spanish.For Applicants Based in California - California Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://rb.gy/lqu5mv)About UsPicsart is the world’s largest digital creation platform and a top 20 most downloaded app. Every month, the Picsart community creates, remixes, and shares billions of visual stories using the company’s powerful and easy-to-use editing tools. Picsart has amassed one of the largest open-source content collections in the world, including free-to-edit photos, stickers, backgrounds, templates, and more. Picsart is available in 30 languages for free and as a subscription on iOS, Android, Windows devices and on the Web. Headquartered in Miami, with offices around the world, Picsart is backed by SoftBank, Sequoia Capital, DCM Ventures, Insight Partners, and others. Download the app or visit picsart.com for more information.

132.description:
ZEAL Network SE is an international, listed group of companies that has been creating exciting and entertaining lottery experiences for over 20 years. In Germany, we are the largest provider of online lotteries through our brands, LOTTO24 and Tipp24. In Spain we work with the second largest national lottery, ONCE. Through ZEAL Ventures, we are involved in exciting e-commerce start-ups such as Omaze and DAYMADE. We have 180+ employees from various countries who act independently and think in a visionary way. Our corporate culture is characterized by team spirit, empowerment, and high ambition. Together we have a clear goal: to encourage people to dream.To further accelerate our growth, we are looking for two new team members to join our agile development teams as Product Manager (f/m/x) in the domains of Marketing Management and Lotteries. 134.description:
Information Department:BW Converting Solutions is a strategic alliance of resources and services that brings together the following six Barry Wehmiller companies: Paper Converting Machine Company (PCMC), Winkler + Dünbier (W+D), STAX Technologies, Hudson-Sharp, Baldwin Technologies and Northern Engraving and Machine. These industry leaders offer proven brands and innovative technologies in the design, manufacture and maintenance of high-performance converting and packaging machinery for the woven, nonwovens, hygiene, bag converting, shipping and printing industries. Barry-Wehmiller is a diversified global supplier of engineering, consulting and manufacturing technology solutions for packaging, corrugating and paper converting industries. Combining a people-focused leadership style with operational strategies and sustainable growth, Barry-Wehmiller has grown into a $3 billion company whose nearly 12,000 employees share a common vision: Building a Better World through Business. Job Description: The Product Manager will create, maintain, and oversee long-term global product line development for mailing solutions products for envelope converting, mail inserting & overprinting portfolios.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Conduct a comprehensive Product Life Cycle analysis focused on driving new product development to include, but not limited to, advances in technology, analysis, voice of customer, market positioning, pricing, cost competitor, and trend analysis. Plan and facilitate market research events. Create, maintain, and take ownership of product development roadmaps. Organize and prioritize engineering development needs and new ideas to address market requirements. Follow structured product development & delivery methodology for new product development and manage the pipeline of projects at all stages of development from idea generation to product launch. Plan and facilitate internal activities to support new product introductions, to included but not limited to product training, marketing launch support plans and marketing conditioning. Seek input and support from cross-functional leaders. Oversee execution of new development projects including aligning resources, facilitating design reviews, building and testing. Creation, forecasting and management of the overall development financial budget and individual project budgets. Partner with Project Management to facilitate and execute manufacturing and testing of new development projects. Work with sales leaders and marketing teams to develop strategies and materials to support and promote new products. Perform other duties as assigned.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or related OR an Associate's Degree in a technical field. At least five years of product development experience.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES: Demonstrated knowledge of product line features, functions, competitors, and market trends. Working knowledge of systems including Infor CRM/CPQ, XA, and SolidWorks. Working knowledge of standard engineering standards and procedures. Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite. Ability to travel approximately 40% domestically and internationally. Experience with PLCM and SWOT analysis are preferred.

The approximate pay range for this position is $130,000-160,000. Please note that the pay range provided is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. 135.name: enfore
135.description:
Small is beautiful, welcome to enfore...More than 200 million small businesses worldwide work hard every day to create a pleasant customer experience. We founded enfore to equip these companies with technology that enables them to compete in the connected world. Through innovative hardware and powerful software as well as extensive service offerings, enfore delivers a POS solution that connects all operational aspects. Working at enfore is not necessarily for everyone, not because we are better or worse, but because we are disciplined, focused, reliable and trustworthy. Every day, as long as necessary.As a Product Manager*, you will be part of an experienced and international team that values ​​and practices transparency, supportive feedback and direct communication. You are responsible for influencing business results and roadmap definitions and making an important contribution. You will work across teams and support the implementation of high-quality features and user stories. What to expect... You will accompany and support the planning and coordination of our software development and create our innovative product for our customers. You will create and maintain the product backlog and support the creation of User stories for the development teamYou understand requirements and translate them into user storiesYou coordinate internal and external stakeholders that are relevant to the successful development of our productsYou have a clear idea of ​​the product roadmap, which is based on feedback from customers and stakeholders as well as market researchYou understand the business area or functions from the end user perspective. You are committed not only to the process, but also to the end product and its vision
What we need... Successfully completed studies in computer science, business informatics or comparable trainingFirst professional experience as part of internships or as a working student as well as interest in classic and agile project management, software development and requirements managementStructured and solution-oriented way of working, hands-on mentality and ability to work in a teamBasic technical understanding of programming languagesSolid social skills Competence and the ability to clearly communicate business requirements to your team. Very good knowledge of German and English for national and international collaboration
Why enfore...At enfore we are passionate about building products. We put our heart and soul into building a platform and apps that are beautifully designed and technologically sophisticated. Achieving this requires a lot of talent, passion, persistence and determination. Our goal is to digitize one of the last untapped markets in the world and thus make it more competitive. This refers to SMEs, which represent an important aspect and shape and determine entire cityscapes as well as our quality of life. The complexity of our vision and our product requires a high level of intrinsic motivation with an accompanying high demand for one's own work and the respective environment. In your role as Product Manager*, you and your team will make a significant contribution to ensuring that we come a little closer to this goal every day. If you really want to make a difference and your work is more than just a means to an end, we are the place to be in our offices in Hamburg and Berlin.---------------- ------------------*At enfore we value equality and are against any kind of discrimination. Regardless of ethnic origin, gender, religion or belief, disability, age or sexual identity, all candidates and employees are given equal opportunities. We celebrate diversity and are committed to integration and diversity.

DELIVER LIKE A GROWN-UP.SHARE YOUR PASSION.Anticipating drivers' needs and meeting them with premium contextual digital experiences is the role of the digital services department within the BMW Group. Are you an experienced Product Manager up for engaging millions of players in our hit game, Merge Mansion?Ready to join one of Europe's fastest growing game companies?If yes, Metacore could be the right place for youWe are a game company from Helsinki best known for our hit game Merge Mansion and our people-first company culture. Built on trust, our culture allows us to work autonomously, efficiently, and ambitiously. We have mutually agreed on five cultural norms to describe how we build trust and work as Metacore – you can find them here: https://metacoregames.com/cultureOur company’s mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades. We already entertain 50M+ players worldwide and have grown into a team of 170+ game industry professionals in less than three years. And now, we're expanding to Berlin, one of Europe's key talent hubs for game companies, and we’re in the process of building our first Merge Mansion feature team to work from this vibrant city. This is where we hope you come in: to make us even better at engaging millions of players in our hit game, Merge Mansion, with in-game events and other activations.ResponsibilitiesProduct Manager plays a key role in improving our player experience and creating a positive impact on Merge Mansion’s performance through different activations. RequirementsEvery role is eventually shaped to match our unique passions, backgrounds and strengths. Here are some of the key skills and experience you should already have when joining Metacore as a Product Manager: 5+ years of experience working in a live game, that will enable you to take ownership of your discipline from day oneTrack record of impacting game performance, so you know the most effective ways to increase engagement and monetization of the game, in a way that feels like an enjoyable experience for our playersSolid data analysis skills, especially related to widely used tools and dashboards, however technical data skills are not mandatoryA good understanding of the player journey in a F2P mobile game from engagement to purchase behavior.Knowledge of F2P monetization drivers that’ll allow you to strategically support upcoming featuresProactive team player with high level of ownership, so it’s in your DNA to continuously find new ways to create more value for our players

Then we are looking for you - and forward to receiving your application ????!What You Will Do Manage and work on highly innovative digital productsBe responsible for products around our core product, the ReerdigungDrive the digital transformation in a very old industryUtilise modern software and systems with low- and no-code, such as Airtable and nolocoManaging and improving data structure of our tools, such as CRM and marketing tool (Hubspot)Setting up and improving existing reporting structures (in Looker Studio, Hubspot, etc.)Manage and align with internal (e.g. Marketing, Partner Management, Business Development, etc.) and external stakeholders (e.g. funeral homes or agencies)

About UsWe at MEINE ERDE revolutionise the burial industry by providing a truly beautiful, life-affirming and sustainable approach to the end of life. At the same time, we contribute to keeping our planet liveable. Within 40 days our burial method transforms a body into fertile soil. We call this process “natural organic reduction” (respectively “Reerdigung” in German).
